edu.metrostate.ics240.p2.towers

Class Towers

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.metrostate.ics240.p2.towers.Towers

  • public class Towers
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Towers()
      Initializes Towers with DEFAULT_TOWER_SIZE (set to five) rings on the first peg and zero on the others two.
      Towers(int n)
      Initializes Towers with between 1 and 64 rings on the first peg and no rings on the other two pegs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Enter peg number get number of rings pegNumber is 1, 2, or 3.
      int getTopDiameter(int pegNumber)
      Gives the diameter of the ring on the top of the specified peg (1, 2, or 3).

      Moves the top ring of one peg to one of the other two pegs.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Towers

        public Towers(int n)
        Initializes Towers with between 1 and 64 rings on the first peg and no rings on the other two pegs. The diameters of the first peg's rings are from one inch (on the top) to n inches (on the bottom).
        Parameters:
        n - Number of rings on peg 1

      • Towers

        public Towers()
        Initializes Towers with DEFAULT_TOWER_SIZE (set to five) rings on the first peg and zero on the others two.

    • Method Detail

      • getRingCount

        public int getRingCount(int pegNumber)
        Enter peg number get number of rings pegNumber is 1, 2, or 3.
        Parameters:
        pegNumber - 1,2,3
        Returns:
        number of rings on the specified peg

      • getTopDiameter

        public int getTopDiameter(int pegNumber)
        Gives the diameter of the ring on the top of the specified peg (1, 2, or 3).
        Parameters:
        pegNumber - Number of the peg
        Returns:
        if getRingCount(pegNumber) is more than 0, returns the diameter of the top ring otherwise is zero.

      • move

        public boolean move(int startPeg,
                    int endPeg)
        Moves the top ring of one peg to one of the other two pegs. The starting peg must have a ring that is smaller than the top peg of the target peg to move.
        Parameters:
        startPeg - is a peg number (1, 2, or 3)
        endPeg - is a peg number (1, 2, or 3) not equal to startPeg
        Returns:
        If precondition is not true, return value is false and pegs are unchanged, otherwise the top ring has been moved from startPeg to endPeg and return value is true.
